page.title: 01ABERDYFI AND DYFI ESTUARY
page.content: Located at the southern edge of the Snowdonia National Park the Dyfi Estuary is the historical meeting place of North and South Wales. The northern shore rises steeply from the estuary waters into a succession of hills culminating at the summit of Cader Idris.A network of mountain tracks and paths make the area particularly rewarding for the energetic walker. The whole estuary up to the high water mark forms part of the Dyfi National Nature Reserve.An information centre at Ynylas is situated at the mouth of the estuary on the southern shore. The attractive holiday resort of Aberdyfi is located where the rocky northern side of the estuary gives way to a sandy beach backed by dunes which stretch almost four miles to Tywyn.
